newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Nigeria Aug oil flow well over 2mbd-official repor.
newsitem.headline: Nigeria Aug oil flow well over 2mbd-official repor.

text.p: Nigeria's crude oil output in August was 2.155 million barrels per day (bpd) in August, up 3.2 percent from the previous month, according to an official report released on Tuesday.

"Total crude oil production in August 1996 was 66,834,201 barrels reflecting a daily average of 2,155,942 barrels," said the monthly progress report on petroleum industry activities prepared by the Department of Petroleum Resources (DPR).
Like most other members of OPEC, the figures showed Nigerian output was well above its mandated quota of 1.865 million bpd.
The DPR report also showed condensate output rose 4.3 percent from the preceding month to 109,300 bpd.
DPR said crude oil processing in Nigerian refineries also rose in August. "The national products stock improved substantially thereby reducing products imports," it said.

The country's four refineries operated at vastly higher levels -- Kaduna in the north at 50 percent, Warri in the midwest at 68 percent while the two refineries in Port Harcourt in the southeast averaged 71 percent.
